summary:
As a dedicated software engineer with a strong focus on Azure cloud solutions, backend development, and distributed systems, I have extensive experience in building and optimizing systems that handle large-scale traffic. My expertise spans microservices architecture, system design, and the implementation of highly scalable and resilient infrastructures. I thrive on solving complex technical challenges and continuously improving system performance and reliability.

With a passion for leveraging cloud technologies and modern architectural patterns, I am always eager to collaborate on projects that push the boundaries of scalability and efficiency.

projects.description:
A python program that detects and recognizes American Sign Language from real-time video and translates it into text using various image processing techniques.

Techniques & Algorithms : 
 
1) Hand detection :

     1- Smoothing using Gaussian filter to remove noise.
     2- Segmentation by skin tone using Log-Chromaticity.
     3- Background subtraction.
     4- Face removal using "Haar Cascade" algorithm.
     5- Closing to fill hand region.

2) Feature extraction :

1- Find contours to find the largest contour (hand).
2- Convex hull of the hand.
3- Convexity defects to get defects in the convex hull.

3) Classification by number of fingers in each direction, orientation and bounding box ratio.
projects.title: American-Sign-Language-Recognition

member.occupation: Software Engineer

projects.description:
The famous battleships multiplayer game written entirely in x86 assembly as a microprocessors coursework project. The game can be played on 2 different PCs using serial communication (with customized communication protocols). It is implemented in the x86 assembly graphics mode from scratch. The game also includes a dedicated chatting mode as well as an in-game chat.
This was a team project, I implemented the whole game and power-ups (reflect an attack, attack twice, destroy a random ship) logic.

For more info about the game itself please refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battleship_(game)
projects.title: Battleship Multiplayer Desktop Game

projects.description:
A software engineering coursework project implemented using Python (Flask), Angular and React Native (Javascript). This is a replica of Twitter, called Kwikker.
 It provides all the main functionalities of Twitter including different timelines, profiles, tweets, direct messages, live notifications, etc.
This was a team project consisting of several sub-teams (back-end developers, front-end developers, testers, DevOps, mobile developers). 
I was a member in the front-end developers team. I Implemented 3 responsive pages (Home, Profile and Error Page) with a service to mimic Backend Services. All unit tests were implemented using Karma and all codes were documented using Compodoc
projects.title: Kwikker - A Replica of Twitter

summary:
I'm a Software Engineer with over 4 years of experience building scalable, user-centric web applications. Most recently, I worked at Interview Query, where I developed and maintained features used by thousands of candidates preparing for data science interviews. My work there spanned full-stack development using MySQL, React, and Go, as well as contributions to the content team—authoring and reviewing technical interview questions and solutions for the platform’s blog and newsletter.

Before Interview Query, I worked at EJADA, one of the Middle East’s leading IT solutions providers, where I built and deployed Java-based enterprise applications for a variety of clients. I hold a Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Engineering from Cairo University.

I'm passionate about solving real-world problems through clean, efficient code and enjoy working in collaborative, innovative environments. I'm always looking to grow my technical skillset and stay current with new tools and technologies.

summary:
I'm a DevOps Engineer with over three years of experience optimizing cloud infrastructure and automating workflows across AWS, GCP, Azure, and G42 Cloud. I specialize in managing scalable, secure systems, leveraging tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Jenkins to streamline CI/CD pipelines and enhance operational efficiency. 

Currently at Core42, I serve as a CloudOps Engineer, where I leverage cutting-edge cloud services like ECS, Cloud Eye, CCE, and more to optimize and monitor mission-critical systems.

With a strong background in infrastructure as code and monitoring solutions like Prometheus and Datadog, I ensure high availability and performance for mission-critical applications. Certified in AWS SysOps, Solutions Architecture, and Cloud DevOps, I’m passionate about driving digital transformation and continuous improvement in every project.

Key skills:
Cloud: AWS, GCP, Azure, G42 Cloud
CI/CD: Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Atlantis
Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
IaC: Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation
Monitoring: Prometheus, Datadog, Grafana
Scripting: Python, Bash

Let’s connect to explore opportunities in cloud and DevOps!
